attributes.action: Allow Havering to secede from the GLA and rejoin Essex as a county borough
attributes.additional_details:
Havering must leave the GLA and rejoin Essex as a county borough because of the following reasons: 

- Restore local control, autonomy and access to county-level services. 
- Tax rates in Essex are lower, making it more affordable for residents to live there.
- Havering would be able to preserve its unique culture and history
- It would be better equipped to address local issues. 

Overall, leaving the GLA would greatly benefit residents and improve the quality of life in Havering.
attributes.background: Ever since Havering was made part of Greater London in 1965, we have greatly lost our local authority and freedom. Being a part of Greater London has caused Havering to deal with London-wide laws and restrictions, like the ULEZ, which don't conform to our beliefs and needs.

rejection.details:
Proposals for changes to local authority boundaries are the responsibility of the relevant local authorities, not the Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
